website_summaries.verdict: An affordable hydration vest with user-friendly features, a lightweight design, and lots of space for gear and water; but the trade off is the possibility of some durability concerns.
pros: Offers a comfortable fit that's lightweight yet has 7 spacious pockets
Fits up to 2 liters of water
Doesn't have the tendency to bounce when running or walking
Falls on the lower end of the price scale
cons: Some longevity concerns noted, as components such as zippers, straps, and buckles have been known to malfunction or break

customer_reviews.title: I run a TON of Spartan Races... ...
customer_reviews.text: I run a TON of Spartan Races... I used this pack at the NJ Beast! The front pockets are clutch!!!! Quick access to snacks, gels, gum etc.. is very important when you're running elite and just can't stop! This pack is going with me to Ohio to run another Beast this weekend!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Decent Pack for Ultrabeast
customer_reviews.text: Used this while competing in a Spartan Ultrabeast. The pack is relatively comfortable. I did use tape to secure all of the loose straps. The chest straps don't stay centered well, require constant adjusting to reduce judder when running. This item is very similar in style, color, etc to a Camelbak pack....but at a fraction of the cost. The only real kinda negative is the depth of the front pockets. When i drop my phone into the front zipper pockets, its tough to fish it out. Overall though, for the price, i don't regret the buy and am happy with the purchase. For reference, I've owned this pack for more than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product!
customer_reviews.text: This pack is great! Used it on my first Marathon, and it was perfect! No bounce, no shifting, no chafing! It holds a lot of items! I just couldn't justify spending $50-$75 for other packs, this was perfect! The 2 straps across your chest are adjustable, no one mentiins that, and i discpvered it by accident. They slide up and down.
customer_reviews.author: Andie M.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight  nice pockets in front holds 70oz bladder
customer_reviews.text: I was going to return it before I got it because no hydration bladder. But this little bag is perfect. I love the pockets up front for snacks phone even a water bottle if you don’t need that much water. It’s so compact it’s perfect for a long bicycle ride or hiking. I just bought a 70 oz insulated bladder and it fit well . Not sure that the pouch in back can hold my helmet., but no worries other way to attach it if need be. If you don’t need a day pack and just want to carry keys phone some snacks and water this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Stillwell

customer_reviews.title: This pack is full of useful pockets and design features
customer_reviews.text: I use this pack for local 2-3 hour mountain bike rides. The size makes it cooler on hot days and I'm still able to get all the essentials in a pack of this size. My goal was to be able to reach my phone, air pump, energy bar, and small tool kit without taking the pack off. The selection of front pockets works perfectly and I still have room for puncture repair stuff and other tools in the back. This pack is full of useful pockets and design features. I'm also a trail runner so I may buy another one for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: pvt

customer_reviews.title: I ran 12 miles Saturday and this was great. I only filled it 1/2 way (bought my ...
customer_reviews.text: This vest was exactly what I was looking for. I'm not a runner and not used to being without water for extended periods. I ran 12 miles Saturday and this was great. I only filled it 1/2 way (bought my own 2 ltr bladder) so I wouldn't have the extra weight. It was the perfect amount. There was some sloshing around as I ran but perhaps it needed to be cinched down a little tighter. which I did at the 1/2 way point. I was able to keep my phone, an energy bar, a pack of gels and a small washcloth in the front pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and Highly adjustable pack
customer_reviews.text: If you check out my other reviews, I withhold 5 stars unless a product is just impeccable - but there aren't too many products like that. First off - If you are ordering this harness/daypack thinking you will receive a bladder and straw, please review the product page. The bladders aren't that expensive and I would suggest a 2-2.5L bladder. On to the build to the pack - -Good quality stitching -VERY adjustable - lots of options -Lots of small zippered pockets -High Quality reflective material
customer_reviews.author: BubbaGump

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, no chafing!
customer_reviews.text: The pack is very comfortable. No rubbing, chafing, or discomfort issues. I lost a front clip strap during a 26+mi Spartan UltraBeast, and had to make due with just 1 strap. Luckily they slide up and down to the most suitable position, so it was a bit awkward, but nothing completely detrimental. If I didnt have water bottles in the front, I might not have noticed as soon, but the extra weight bounced around a bit. I contacted to ask if it was possible to replace the strap, and I was offered a whole new pack :) Cant beat that! Thanks again Lanzon Direct and Lucille!
customer_reviews.author: WindigoTW

customer_reviews.title: I'm Happy
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. All I know is it's really nice to have somewhere to carry a water bottle (I just take a 16oz plastic one) that's easily accessible while running (thanks to the front pouches). I also like that I can put my phone in the other pocket (I have a Google pixel 3A XL, so it's big) so I can listen to music. I don't really use the back part yet. If I do it'll probably just be for my keys or something. Everything was adjustable so I was able to fit it to my body with no bouncing...I have tried those running belts before and can already tell this is WAAAAY better. I'm happy ☺️
customer_reviews.author: Cass&Art Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: I truly love this backpack it is perfect for running light weight ...
customer_reviews.text: I truly love this backpack it is perfect for running light weight great fit it’s everything it says it is definitely not a day pack or anything you want to carry a lot but if you’re running a long time and you want your phone key is headphone maybe some water etc. this is perfect and definitely worth the price compared to other higher priced brand-name is this one definitely looks as good quality it’s not like a cheap Amazon backpack or anything really good quality amazing price
customer_reviews.author: CPSG

customer_reviews.title: Great deal - easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a 10 year old camelback that was slightly leaky. Big improvement! This bladder is SO EASY to clean! The vest itself is great, lots of pockets, lightweight. I know people have asked about it fitting kids - I would say no. I’m 5’ 4” / 110lbs and with all the straps tightened its still just a smidge too loose. Just ran yesterday and carried a map, snacks, phone, pepper spray, and Gatorade of course - still had room for plenty more with minimal bouncing around.
customer_reviews.author: L. Toohill

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for hiking and running!
customer_reviews.text: The front straps are very wide to accommodate water bottles and the back is made to carry a hydration reservoir (not included). Construction is very light weight, but still has ample strength. Best part is the hidden pouch inside the top flap to store keys, wallet or a cell phone. The back bungee pouch is just big enough to carry a light jacket too. Only criticism is that it's on the small side, but I think that it's intended to be that way. Overall great pack for hiking and running!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Pack!
customer_reviews.text: This pack fits great and holds a 1.5 & 2 ltr bladder well. I use this for running, and for participation in obstacle races. The fit is snug and secure without adding bulk (others were loose and I couldn't run comfortably in them). The pockets fit just enough to take for fuel/energy (protein bars, goo shots, etc) as well as a phone if needed. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: talula2010

customer_reviews.title: A pleasant surprise for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: So I didn't want to leave a review until I had gone on a few longish runs first. I got this pack a few weeks ago, and I've been on two 6 mile runs and one 9 mile run. I was expecting issues, because even though the reviews are really high, it's an incredibly inexpensive pack. I was wrong! There is absolutely no bouncing and it rides high enough on my shoulders to feel secure, but not too high that my shoulders hurt. For comparisons, I am 5'8" tall and 140 lbs. I highly recommend this pack.
customer_reviews.author: Summer S Elam

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hold a water bladder (purchased separately) for short hikes and a walking relay I take part in every summer. It worked perfectly on my recent hike, and has plenty of pockets for my phone, small camera, gels, snacks, etc. It has plenty of straps and adjustable buckles to make it fit snugly and comfortably (I'm 5'5", size 18). Love the bright colors for visibility as well. So far I've only used it to hike, but it will definitely get a lot of use!
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Good vest for the price
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a runner and she loves the light weight and versatility of this vest. She’s had one for three years now and used it almost weekly. After numerous races it’s showing the wear, so I thought it was time for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil

customer_reviews.title: Ran a Trail Half with this Pack and love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this pack! I ran my first trail half marathon with this pack and my own two liter water resevior. It holds plenty of snacks and water for long runs. It also doesn’t run anywhere and cinches down tightly. I have a 34 inch chest and initially thought it’d be too big and bounce around but the pack adjusts well and stays put. A great value.
customer_reviews.author: C. McKean

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hydration vest! I've used it 3 times on longer runs and it's lightweight and comfortable. I had previously been using a running belt and wasn't sure if this would make my back too hot (I live in Texas). The mesh padding provided excellent breathe-ability. I chose the vest that comes with the hydration bladder, and love the bladder too! Easy to clean with no leaking, and the bite valve is easy to drink from on the run. Plenty of pockets too for extra hydration bottles, gels, and phone. Finally, the adjustable/ sliding straps on the front prevent bounce. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: T. Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: I loved all the pockets but for my marathon, just a bit heavy, cheap made and fit awkward on shoulders. Plus, super long straps for some reason. Also, doesn't have a clip to hold your flask tube. It's ok I suppose for maybe hiking, just not for running.
customer_reviews.author: Reverend_Chin

customer_reviews.title: Great vest
customer_reviews.text: I have used this hydration vest several times and for me it has been perfect. I am 6"4' and 255 and it was hard to find a vest that fits. I also use to use a backpack with a bladder but on long runs it was inconvenient to refill the bladder. The multiple pouches help carry plenty of water and water bottles are easier to refill for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: barely know it is there...
customer_reviews.text: ...until you need it! I recently upgraded to a newer phone and was needing a new armband before going on longer runs, but I ended up using this bag instead. I am not planning to get an armband and instead will just always use this light pack. Super light weight, plenty of pockets and storage and great for running. I will plan to also use this for light day hikes and may keep it stored in my vehicle so I am ready to go at anytime!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R. Callaway

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for fast trail runs
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up vs pricier options for my trail runs and love it! Im a hiker with a top brand pack so I enjoy design that allows me to properly adjust for fit and this checks the boxes for a fast moving run. Great spot for hydration, my phone, and little pockets for small light things. Great price and excellent fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great Pack...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my niece who is a distance runner on her track team. She's 16 5'4" 109 and this pack fits her perfectly! She usually only uses a 1 liter bladder, when she runs 3 miles or more. This pack has nice compartments to store key's, mp3 player, snacks, etc.. At least two other girls were looking at them too. It comes in bright colors, and black and white. She wanted me to say that she gives this pack a 5 outta 5, and I got a great Big Hug and a Thank you note!
customer_reviews.author: Earl HammerTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact hydration vest with lots of easily accessible pockets
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact hydration vest with lots of easily accessible pockets. I initially bought this for running but found it to be too heavy to carry for a marathon distance. Would probably be a good for hiking though I haven't gotten to try it out yet. One problem I encountered was cleaning and drying out afterwards, if anyone has any tips on this, please share! I couldn't figure out how to remove the hard plastic mouthpiece once it was clicked into the tubing. That would make it much easier and quicker to drain and dry the water out. Otherwise, great product!
customer_reviews.author: Tricia M

customer_reviews.title: All the features. Half the price.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this pack. Perfect for long trail running. All the fit and features of the expensive packs at a fraction of the price. Light as a feather. Just enough pockets. Love the bladder with slide-on clip. Easy to open and clean. Make sure you order WITH the bladder, as the Lanzon bladder fits the pack better than competitors. Feels sturdy, though I haven't used it long.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Very adjustable and fits large phones in the front.
customer_reviews.text: I have a few other hydration packs and all are good for different things. This one I love because it holds my Samsung edge in the front zippered pocket and it can hold a jacket and bladder in the back. I take this on all of my shorter runs so I usually only have a small bottle in the front drawstring pockets with my phone, wallet. keys and a snack all in the front. Very adjustable so my husband can also use it and with minimal adjusting its back in size to fit me.
customer_reviews.author: CaraR

customer_reviews.title: Great value for an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied with the product, I find that the number of pockets are sufficient for extra water, food, keys, etc. I particularly like the external pockets with a mesh like material which grant easy access to items such as cellphone or water bottle. I tried the pack on trail and asphalt for hours at a time and I've never had any rash, the pack is also very easy to wash afterwards. I would suggest placing one of the chest straps a bit higher to avoid the pack straps from separating and ending up over your shoulders, this happens to me, might be because I've got big traps.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Luna Pezo

customer_reviews.title: Design changed, product flops
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. I purchased an older model a yesr ago in marchish 2018. However I bought another in April 2019. The design has changed. The pocket and straps are larger, the mesh is thiner, and the closures do not alow women or ghin men to tighten the vest well, so its very very loose and jiggles. They ruined a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mehrdad Vaziri

customer_reviews.title: This was the best investment I made for the 3 day
customer_reviews.text: This was the best investment I made for the 3 day, 60 mile breast cancer walk that I did in August!!! The two front pouches for water bottles were absolutely the most convenient thing about it. All the other pockets and pouches allowed me to carry most of everything I needed. Easy on, and easy off. I think it is perfect for hiking, walking or biking!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bernette Berry

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BAG - GREAT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: This bag fit perfectly from the first time I put it on! My 3rd run with the bag was HOT (90) and 18 miles, though I sweated like a pig i didn’t develop any rub points! I have done 20+ runs/bike rides with it and love it! Ive ran with a collapsible bottle in the front pocket, or a full 2L bladder in the back and the bag preforms perfectly!! The customer service of LANZON is great as well! Quick responses and top notch service!! You wont be able to beat the comfort of this bag for anywhere close to this price!! So get the bag and get running!!
customer_reviews.author: Shawnell miller

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Hydration pack suits my needs perfectly. Needed a fluid pack but needed pockets/pouches also. Holds all the things I need while working (cell phone, walkie talkie, glasses). I also clip on a mini blue-tooth speaker to the straps so that I can have music with me. Only thing I'm not thrilled with is that the protective cap over the nozzle comes off too easily. The slightest rubbubg or bumping against something knocks it off therefore allowing it to get dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Teo Beam

customer_reviews.title: Hydrating on Long Rides
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack for comfortable hydration during long distance motorcycle rides. It works great! No leaks, comfortable over a 1,000 mile day, and easy to get a drink even while riding down the freeway. The front pockets are large enough to hold some snacks, or a couple cans of energy drinks. Good product, that I will definitely be using on future distance rides.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Giddings

customer_reviews.title: The perfect hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: This hydration pack worked perfectly!! With the 2 liter bladder (sold separately), I had no problems on my first 10K Trail Run. The high cut sides prevented chafing on my arms. It was very comfortable all the way around. And the storage areas make securing cell phones, wallet, keys and other important items in zippered compartments gave peace of mind. There other pockets with elastic draw strings adequate for small water bottles or energy bars. This is probably the best purchase I have ever made on Amazon. Would definitely recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G. Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Great for train running and more!
customer_reviews.text: This vest is exactly what I wanted. I can hold my phone, keys, gels, etc. They are within my reach without stopping to take to pack off. The backpack is handy for longer adventures, or to keep an outer layer. The fit is good, and I run windy trails with lots of up and down. It stays in place and doesn't bounce. Go to gear for longer runs.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Vermont

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this Hydration Pack!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this hydration pack. It is the first one I used and I was hesitant to ever use one thinking it would be too uncomfortable and heavy, but I have been very pleased with this pack. I just ran a 1/2 marathon and without this pack I would not have made it because it was too hot and not enough water stations. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah W

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fot and perfect compartments.
customer_reviews.text: Love this pack. I looked at all the name stores and wasn’t satisfied with for, compartments and decided to look on Amazon. And the cost of most hydration packs are sky high. I took a chance and ordered this one. Love it and the colors are super visible. I run many miles everyday and this one has worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: HELENE NEVILLE

customer_reviews.title: Best value
customer_reviews.text: The pack works well although I am not comfortable wearing one. I have had Camelbacks and not been comfortable. I stuck my old camelback bladder in the pouch. The cost was the real seller in the purchase. The front buckles look flimsy but they are holding so far.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Cute little running pack
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars! My first one ripped after about a year and I left a review. The owner contacted me and sent me an entirely new one for free! Customer service doesn’t get better than that!
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Get it.
customer_reviews.text: No other hydration pack places an emphasis on having lots of pockets accessible on the front side. Very useful for people who use public transit in a crowded urban location. A plus side is that big stores like Walmart tend to let you wear it inside the store maintaining that this is a hydration pack and not an actual backpack.
customer_reviews.author: First Last

customer_reviews.title: Forget it's there
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and decent fitting vest, after a few miles I pretty much forget it's there. For the price it's a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Erik42

customer_reviews.title: Chest straps both failed first use
customer_reviews.text: I used this during a Spartan Beast for the first time this weekend (brand new product), and before the run was over, both of the elastic chest straps broke. I was able to tie them in a knot so I was able to continue, but still quite disappointing. My expectations were not terribly high considering the price point, but this performance was still frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: lbobrien

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for hiking, biking and running!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pack! We have used it for a Ragnar Race, A Triathlon and many hikes and bike rides. It’s light and holds up to our crazy family.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Humble

customer_reviews.title: Works great and great customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a follow up review for me. I took it out for the first time on a 9 miler, and the straps slipped off of my shoulders. I wrote a review about it and Lanzon immediately contacted me with a fix. He chest straps are on a track that you can move up and down. Works fine now and 5 stars for customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last for 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The pack is decent for the price, even though I bought it when it was $33, but it didn't last 3 months. The seams are falling apart for the sides as well as the elastic band in the back to hold articles of clothing. I only used it about once per week and it was for runs. Definitely looking for a better quality one.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas N.

customer_reviews.title: Hydration Holder in Vest-like Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for Perfect Hydration 2L / 3L Bladder Pack. Love the many extra storage compartments. Would have loved more had it came in Navy.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this while hiking, and it's a great solution! I tried another water reservoir previously but struggled with how to carry it as I don't like wearing daypacks. The vest style of this product is much more comfortable for me, and the pockets up front provide easy access to my phone, a snack, and other necessities. I bought the package that includes the water reservoir (bladder), and I'm very pleased with it as well. It's easy to clean, and it comes with a cover for the mouthpiece. Oh, one more things... I ordered this on a Sunday, and it arrived the next day!!!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: This hydration pack is well built with lots of options ...
customer_reviews.text: This hydration pack is well built with lots of options for carrying additions with you on the trail. I admit, the size if this pack is very small if your a tall person, but works perfectly for an average size girl. As a tall person it sits very high up on the back. Despite the size, it's very well built.
customer_reviews.author: J. Orman

customer_reviews.title: Great hydration pack for running!
customer_reviews.text: Bought my hydration pack last month, used it on a 50K and a marathon, both in up to 88°F weather. Feels like wearing a vest not a pack, not hot or heavy at all! Good sturdy construction, well fitted for 6' guy with 41" chest. Sliding clasps help a lot for snug fit when in motion. Front deep zippered pockets easily hold my 6" phone and all the gels and bars I need. Water bottles very easily accessible from front mesh pockets. Main back compartment fits 2L bladder well. 3rd zippered pocket on inside cover of main compartment is perfect for storing keys and wallet. Thumbs up for Lanzon hydration pack!
customer_reviews.author: Harry S.

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack for running
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this for running. He uses this for running in the mountains and on the road. Will buy again when it’s time for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great Hydration Pack
customer_reviews.text: A great Hydration Pack. I am reviewing now that I have completed several runs wearing it. It was easy to adjust (took a few runs to get it perfect), it has minimal bounce/movement and I have not had any chafing from it. I love the pockets on the chest. I can place my phone and other things that I need frequently there for easy access.
customer_reviews.author: Rowdy

customer_reviews.title: The product was great and held all that I needed (water
customer_reviews.text: Wore this for my half marathon to keep the weight off my hips. The product was great and held all that I needed (water, gu packets, phone, ID and long sleeve shirt in storage pack) I should have re-read the info on the front -----Slidable clasps across the front allow for a snug fit without bounce around while running, cycling, hiking or any other exercising--- This is critical to making this wonderful pack work for all sizes. I had to learn the hard way but once adjusted, perfect. Thank you for making an affordable pack that works great for running the longer distances.
customer_reviews.author: Joni Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly suprised by the quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and the 2L Bladder to carry water for my trail runs. The pack fits well and does not bounce around. The pockets are well thought out and hold a decent amount of stuff. Oh yea, I'm really impressed by the construction quality of this pack bearing in mind the price I payed for it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: it's not the greatest quality but for the price i'm happy with it. i use it for distance running and has plenty of storage to carry what you need.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mutz

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've only used the bladder once but it seemed to work fine. The hose tube is very heavily insulated which makes it kind of bulky and slightly too long. I have used the pack without the bladder and just a water bottle in the front pocket a few times and it works great, allowing me to carry a few items along with the water bottle and still have hands free. Over all, a great value compared to the competition.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Hydration pack for the price
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use this pack on a hike last week. I like the way it fits and how you can put all of your stuff (car keys, phone etc) in the front pockets so you don't have to keep it in your shorts or pants. My 2L hydration bladder fit nicely in the back as well. I only used it for hiking and not for trail running though.
customer_reviews.author: Andrejs Jakovlevs

customer_reviews.title: Able to carry lots of water.
customer_reviews.text: Nice lightweight backpack. Fit the camelbak 2L badder perfect. Also can fit a bottle of each strap. Also has storage for energy gel and snacks on the front straps. The pack itself has quick storage area that has elastic that can be tighten down, good place to pack your jacket when you don't need it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amory Quinn Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This pack has been very affordable and convenient. The dual front pockets work much better than a large pocket in the back. For one, it forces me to be more thoughtful about what I take on a long run. Secondly, they are easier to access than rear facing pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah D Cox

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pack for the sole purpose of running Ragnar Relay. Used a 2L camelback reservoir and it fit inside well. Ran 22 miles, carried iPhone 7 in one strap pouch and a stick of body glide in the other. As long as you push all the air out of your reservoir and cinch the pack down tight, you won't even know it's there. Only down side is it looks like it's from the dollar tree, but for the price point that's to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for a mountain trail race and it worked out nicely for the price
customer_reviews.text: This pack has worked very well for me. It is lightweight and fit snug on my body. I bought it for a mountain trail race and it worked out nicely for the price. While it feels well constructed and I like the pocket system design, my only complaint is I had trouble getting the pack to fit straight. Somehow it always felt just a little crooked and the adjustment straps didn't seem to change that feeling. Other than that minor issue, great pack!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even feel like you're wearing anything
customer_reviews.text: I used this pack for running. I take it on my long runs over 10 miles. I dont even feel it on and all the extra pockets have been great for holding tissues, cellphone, gels/fuel and chapstick. I usually run with about a liter of water and dont even notice the extra weight.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for runners!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hydration pack! I use it for running (but could also use it for hiking, biking, etc.). While training for a marathon, I used it to run up to 20 miles all at once and it did not cause any rash on my back as other packs have done. Also, I love the multitude of pockets on the front and back. Easy to fill hydration pack is great. I love the front two straps - they adjust for width but also they adjust up and down so you can choose where on your chest/abdomen you want them to sit. I'd definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charisse N. Berree

customer_reviews.title: It's what I need for walking, running, or a short hiking trip.
customer_reviews.text: I tried running belts and they were all bounced around which really annoys me. This allows me to carry the things I need comfortably and without any bounce.
customer_reviews.author: TKing

customer_reviews.title: Great hydration vest
customer_reviews.text: Great hydration vest! I needed something for long runs training for a full marathon but didn't want to spend a fortune since I only needed it on long training runs. This vest is light weight and comfortable. I got no chafing and had plenty of pockets for fuel and phone and keys. I totally recommend it for runners!
customer_reviews.author: Minde

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this with my long runs 13.1miles my hands are free now that I have the water hose and pently of pockets in front to hold my stuff
customer_reviews.author: Mark P.

customer_reviews.title: Great ultra running pack!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my purchase! Using for long distance trail runs, 20+ miles. Fits really well and adjusts quite a bit, front straps slide up and down. Holds an amazing amount of stuff too, I had enough food for a day, water filter, phone, first aid kit and a rain shell, plus my 2L water bladder and there was room for a lot more. I was worried my water pack wouldn't fit but it fit great, stays in place and easy to access it. Prompt shipping too. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: quarter

customer_reviews.title: Great pack
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this purchase. It stays in place, keeps all of my items easily accessible and it feels comfortable. The pouches in front and generally all over the pack are not waterproof. They leak through and can get on your phone if held in the chest pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: The best hydration vest
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy with this hydration vest. It has been a life saver while training for my marathon. The fit is great, it doesn't move around while running. The pockets are deep and spacious. I have only used the front pockets for my phone. I would buy this vest again and most likely will for my daughter. The price was right and the shipping was fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my trail running. Pretty comfortable without much bounce while running.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Fits 10lb Ruck plate too!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Lots of storage space and adjustable and light weight
customer_reviews.author: Dadise D. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price. I had just bought a hydration belt a couple months ago but didn't like the way it felt, took a chance on this because of price and it had positive reviews. This vest is awesome. Comfortable, light-weight, enough pockets for everything and easy to keep things secure them. Run, don't walk to go get one asap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like the compactness
customer_reviews.text: Just exactly what I was looking for a compact hydration pack for day hike hiking and skiing. Nicely made. Reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: RossH

customer_reviews.title: Bladder not included
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product with the intent it was everything included. The actual bladder is not. That’s purchased separately. It does state that in tiny print next to the picture of bladder in the product. If your looking for a compete product this is not the product for you
customer_reviews.author: Resrvoirdog

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Light weight. Love the pockets. Great price. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ridere46

customer_reviews.title: Great pack!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hydration pack. I'm training for my first half marathon and use it on all my longer training runs and it's also now my go to for hikes. It fits super comfy, stays put, holds plenty of water. The pockets are all super nice and easily accessible for my phone, keys etc. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and great for running
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for running and hiking! Fits a 2-3L hydration bag. Super light weight as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No bladder, but it's OK.
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT include the bladder. I didn't look closely enough, I guess. Otherwise, it fits well and high on the back and feels good.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary S. PierceTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I used this pack on a 14 mile trail run and it worked fine. I liked having the front pockets for holding my phone and other small items. My previous pack only had pockets in the back which meant I had to stop running and take to pack off to get things. The pack was comfortable and fit me well (I'm 6'2" / 185lbs).
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Walko

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Holds up to a 70 ounce water bladder.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Quality and fit
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the quality and fit. It is very comfortable. I have owned several camelbaks and this is indistinguishable in quality from the original at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality vest does what it should do. I loved that i was able to fit everything i need when i go jogging and i loved that it is very light weight. I will be ordering the bladder to go along with this.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Other detailed reviews were very helpful and I wanted to second their praise.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Used it in a Spartan race. Worked well despite going through the water and mud. It didn't weigh me down a lot. A little restrictive when climbing over obstacles. When just running it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Keith23

customer_reviews.title: Is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Very practical and lightweight. Plenty of pockets. Great value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slightly Different Design From Photo
customer_reviews.text: Front straps are different than photo. Rear do not have "Close to Nature" on it. Top strap will not stay up high and creeps down when running. Wanted to love it for the price, but disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Canyon Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Works good!
customer_reviews.text: Took it for a 14 mile trail run when I got it and it did the job. I just used a bladder from walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Landon

customer_reviews.title: No chafing,  no bouncing!  Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pack! Great value. Doesn't bounce around and doesn't chafe.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Light and snug fitting
customer_reviews.text: The pack is so light that I do not even realize that I am carrying one. Fits snugly too. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great and affordable hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: Great and affordable hydration pack. Its just as good quality as the more expensive packs. It might be large for a smaller person but fits me great. I am able to fit a couple waters, some snacks and my handgun for long isolated solo runs.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Laws

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Did a 30 mile run in Grand Canyon and this did the job. Nice product and worked well for me.
customer_reviews.author: jdel

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I just tried my pack this week for a short hike, wanted to store my phone, keys and small water bottle (didn't use the bladder yet). It worked perfect and didn't feel bulky or jostle around.
customer_reviews.author: Abby F.

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: Great inexpensive hydration vest. I used my own bladder from my bike camelback and it works perfect. The small design of this vest makes it easy to use, and stays out of my way while running. Many of my friends have paid $ 70.00 + for a similar pack that works just the same.
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY H.

customer_reviews.title: Love it while running
customer_reviews.text: Love it. No bounce while running. Fits everything you could need and more. Ultra marathon training and couldn't live without it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This hydration pack is awesome! I've taken it on two 11
customer_reviews.text: This hydration pack is awesome! I've taken it on two 11,000 foot high mountain hikes and it worked great. I also use it for running. The adjustable straps allow it to stay close to your body without moving around and the water taste great! I like it even more than my old camelbak.
customer_reviews.author: Annisha Lindgren

customer_reviews.title: Great value pack for distance running
customer_reviews.text: Works well and has plenty of straps to reduce bounce. Price is great since I was considering the more expensive larger brands at first. I generally run longer distances and this is pretty comfortable. I am a 5'7" female and the pack fits me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: The hydration pack price is super-accessible, I have a broad back and it fits well on me since it has adjustable straps. The quality of the bladder is a 5 out of 5 stars. The vest has enough compartments for my personal belongings like my personal and job cellphone and a couple of snacks. I truly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Andres Chavez

customer_reviews.title: it’s great, but top strap doesn’t stay in place when ...
customer_reviews.text: it’s great, but top strap doesn’t stay in place when your on the run it slides down and therefore it would feel uncomfortable
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old son bought this for dirt biking and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and clean
customer_reviews.text: I liked that this pack set came with a cleaning brush and hanger- very handy for easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly for when I do my runs. It’s very comfortable to have on for a long period at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Pockets for days!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the pockets on the straps. Allows easy access to fuel,phone, keys ect.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Gaynor

product_meta.title: LANZON 2L Hydration Pack (NO Bladder), Marathon Running Vest, Hiking Cycling Backpack
feature_bullets: Lightweight: the pack is only 12oz/340g of barely noticeable weight.
Breathable shoulder straps and mesh padded back add extra comfort.
Fully adjustable chest straps on the front, and waist straps on the sides allow the pack to fit teenagers through adults.
Sliding chest clasps allow for a snug fit to eliminate bouncing while running, cycling, hiking or any other activities.

7 pockets in total: One main compartment for a 2L bladder(NOT included), a rear lower stretch-mesh pocket with elastic bungee cords for food etc, an interior zip pocket on the flap for cards and keys, 2 sweat-proof zip pockets on the shoulder harnesses allow easy access to your gadgets and phone(fits phones up to 5.5"), 2 stretch-mesh pouches on the front keep nutrition and extra water bottles handy.
